p: From a molecular perspective, the SARS-CoV-2 is an enveloped, single-stranded, positive-sense RNA virus and represents the eighth coronavirus that can be transmitted from human to human [ 4]. Bats, which are reservoir hosts of various zoonotic viruses, including the Hendra and Nipah viruses, have been indicated as putative key reservoirs of coronavirus in China [ 5]. From a genomic standpoint, the SARS-CoV-2 shares approximately 50% and 79% of its genetic sequence with the MERS-CoV and the SARS-CoV, respectively. Furthermore, SARS-CoV-2 shares a receptor-binding domain structure with SARS-CoV [ 6].
